intro: Crotalaria glaucoides, commonly known as the white crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant has a bushy growth habit and produces pods containing seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
